perturbation.original_text:
Article 1.Amendment and Termination of JV Agreement

a.As of the VNBJ Closing, except as expressly set forth in this Amendment, the JV Agreement shall immediately cease to have any application or effect with respect to VNBJ, all rights and obligations with respect to VNBJ under the JV Agreement shall terminate and all references to "Company" or "Companies" in the JV Agreement (either in the body of the JV Agreement or its schedules and other attachments) shall read and be interpreted to mean VNBZ and/or ANRA except as the context otherwise requires.
perturbation.changed_text:
Article 1.Amendment and Termination of JV Agreement

a.As of the VNBJ Closing, except as expressly set forth in this Amendment, the JV Agreement shall immediately cease to have any application or effect with respect to VNBJ, all rights and obligations with respect to VNBJ under the JV Agreement shall terminate. All references to "Company" or "Companies" in the JV Agreement will continue to include VNBJ even after the VNBJ Closing for matters related to pre-closing activities.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that references to VNBJ will continue to include VNBJ for pre-closing activities, directly contradicting the previous statement that the JV Agreement ceases to have any effect with respect to VNBJ after the closing. This creates uncertainty about the extent to which the original agreement still applies after the VNBJ Closing.

perturbation.original_text:
Article 2.D&O Indemnity

Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Parties agree to cause each of VNBJ and VNBZ to comply with Sections 4.3.2 and 4.3.3 of the JV Agreement with respect to the indemnification or reimbursement, as applicable, of all Directors and Officers (except those individuals resigning pursuant to Section 6.2.6 of the VNBJ SPA and Section 6.2.6 of the VNBZ SPA) with respect to any Liabilities arising prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.
perturbation.changed_text:
Article 2.D&O Indemnity

Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Parties agree to cause each of VNBJ and VNBZ to comply with Sections 4.3.2 and 4.3.3 of the JV Agreement with respect to the indemnification or reimbursement, as applicable, of all Directors and Officers with respect to any Liabilities arising prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable. However, this indemnification is only valid if the Directors and Officers continue to be employed by Nissin after the closing date.
perturbation.explanation: This change adds a condition that the D&O indemnity is only valid if the Directors and Officers continue to be employed by Nissin after the closing date. This creates a contradiction because the original text does not impose any such condition and focuses on liabilities arising before the closing, regardless of post-closing employment status. This introduces uncertainty and potential disputes about the applicability of the indemnity.

perturbation.original_text: d.Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the termination of the JV Agreement with respect to VNBJ, VNBZ or the Veoneer Parties shall not release any Veoneer Party or any Nissin Party from liability for the breach of any of its representations, warranties, covenants or agreements set forth in the JV Agreement that arise prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.
perturbation.changed_text: d.Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the termination of the JV Agreement with respect to VNBJ, VNBZ or the Veoneer Parties shall not release any Veoneer Party or any Nissin Party from liability for the breach of any of its representations, warranties, covenants or agreements set forth in the JV Agreement that arise prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable. However, any claims for such breaches must be submitted within 30 days of the VNBJ or VNBZ Closing, otherwise they are waived.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a limitation on the timeframe for claims related to breaches of representations, warranties, etc. The original text states that termination does not release parties from liability for breaches before closing, but this addition introduces a 30-day claim submission deadline, after which claims are waived. This contradicts the original intent of not releasing parties from liability and creates uncertainty as to the enforceability of liabilities arising before the closing.
